newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIA CUTS RATES FOR PAPER ABOVE ONE-WEEK.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIA CUTS RATES FOR PAPER ABOVE ONE-WEEK.

text.p: Indonesia's central bank, Bank Indonesia, cut rates on its short-term certificates (SBIs) for periods of one week and above by 50 basis points while maintaining high rates for shorter-term paper.

The bank cut seven-day bilateral SBIs to 9.5 percent from 10.0 percent, two-week to 10.0 percent from 10.5 percent, one-month to 10.625 percent from 11.125 percent, three months to 10.5 from 11.0, six months to 11.125 from 11.625 and one-year to 11.75 from 12.25 percent.
